definition: Mountain of Flames of legend/fig. insurmountable obstacle/Mountain of Flames in Turpan depression in Xinjiang
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
flame
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan

sentences.english: Not far from Truvan is a Flaming Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 離吐魯番不遠有一座火焰山。

sentences.english: She's right now at the Flame Mountain.
Just a few kilometers further along this range are the famous Bezeklik Caves.
sentences.chinese: 沿着火焰山前進幾公里就是著名的柏孜克里千佛洞。

sentences.english: No, you shouldn't because a fiery mountain ahead is spurting flames far and wide and killing lots of people.
sentences.chinese: 你不能前進，前面有火焰山，噴火數十里，傷人無算。

sentences.english: The exploration accuracy is low in the whole area of Huoyanshan.
sentences.chinese: 整個火焰山地區勘探精度較低。

sentences.english: The car comes to a valley after around half an hour's drive along the Flaming Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 汽車從火焰山走大約半個小時，便來到一條峽谷。

sentences.english: Not far from Turfan lies the 'Flaming Mountain'.
sentences.chinese: 離吐魯番不遠有一座火焰山。

definition: palm-leaf fan
Mount Huaguo in Jiangsu, featured in 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4], tourist destination/(also the name of mountains in other parts of China)
cave with a waterfall at its mouth
Kunlun Mountain range
The Southern Heavenly Gates/a name for a mountain pass gate in several places
the Turpan Depression in Xinjiang
Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1], the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]/Son Goku, the main character in Dragon Ball 七龍珠|七龙珠[Qi1 long2 zhu1]
desert/CL:個|个[ge4]
the Western Paradise (Buddhism)
magma/molten lava
Mt Meru or Sumeru, sacred mountain in Buddhist and Jain tradition/Mt Xumi in Guyuan 固原[Gu4 yuan2], Ningxia, with many Buddhist cave statues
Laozi or Lao-tze (c. 500 BC), Chinese philosopher, the founder of Taoism/the sacred book of Daoism, 道德經|道德经 by Laozi
Buddhist grottos
Tripitaka (602-664), Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator who traveled to India 629-645/same as 玄奘
"heavenly lake", lake situated on a mountain/used as the name of numerous lakes, such as 長白山天池|长白山天池[Chang2 bai2 shan1 Tian1 chi2]
Lake Tianchi in Xinjiang
